The second symbol, with a crossed-out machine on stairs, suggests that the machine should not be used on stairs or steep inclines. The third symbol shows a machine on a ramp with an angle less than 15 degrees, indicating the maximum safe incline for operation. These symbols collectively warn against operating the machine on steep inclines to prevent tipping.

ground_truth: Ramp hazard—do not use dual ramps when loading onto a trailer; use 1 ramp wide enough for the machine; use a ramp with a slope less than 15°;
